text: In this video,
we'll show you how to set up installation
for most simple mods on GTA V for PC.

We'll focus specifically
on two types of mods,

mods that use ASI files and
mods that use DLL files.

Before installing, keep
in mind that GTA V mods
should only be used in single-player mode.
Rockstar Studios bans players
they detect with modded clients
from playing GTA online.
Check the description below

for all the links we
mentioned in this video.
Let's start with ASI mods.

First, locate where GTA V is
downloaded on your computer

and keep the folder
open in the background.
Next, I'm going to OpenIV.com
and download OpenIV client.
Follow the installation steps.

OpenIV allows you to
manage GTA mods easily.
Once downloaded, launch OpenIV.

You'll be given a menu
of multiple GTA games.
Choose GTA V for Windows.
You'll be prompted to give the file path

of where GTA V is
located on your computer.

Go to the folder where
GTA V is downloaded,

copy the file path, and
paste it into the prompt.
You can also use the browse option
and locate where the game is from there.
Green text should appear

confirming OpenIV detected
the game successfully.

Back in OpenIV, go to tools
and choose "ASI Manager."
In the menu that appears,
install ASI Loader and OpenIV Loader.

When prompted, click "Yes" to
the creation of a mods folder.

This now gives you the
option to download ASI mods.
For obtaining the mods themselves,
visit the website GTA5-mods.com,

the most popular page for
the GTA V modding community.
For testing purposes,

we'll download a
simple-to-use mod, Menyoo.
The mod Menyoo allows you to use cheats

including additional
customization to characters

or spawning in additional
weapons and vehicles.

Use the website search
bar to find the mod.
When you select it,
you'll see a description of it
as well as the controls to use it in game.
Click "Download,"

and you'll be redirected
to the mod's GitHub page,
where you can download the latest version.

Open the downloaded zip file
and extract all the contents.
Move everything from the folder
that opens into the mods folder

of the GTA V base
directory on your computer.
Launch GTA V.
You will be able to use your mod
as instructed on the GTA5-mod website.
If the mod doesn't work,

a common reason is that the
version of OpenIV downloaded
is not up to date with GTA V's updates.

In that case, a reliable fix
is going to this website.
Download and extract the contents.
Copy and paste the contents of the folder
into the base directory of GTA V,
and your issue will be fixed
as long as Script Hook V is up to date.
To use DLL mods, go back to GTA5-mod.com
and search "community script hook v.net."
Click "Download," and you'll be redirected
to the GitHub page where you can download
the necessary zip file.

Open and extract the
contents of the zip file.
Then copy and paste the files
into GTA V's base directory.

Make a new folder called
"scripts" in that directory.
From there, select the mod of your choice
with the DLL file type from GTA5-mods.com.
For this mod type in particular,
go to the ".NET" tag on the scripts page.

In this case, we'll use a driving
mode selection script mod,

which allows you to upgrade
your driving experience
by switching between four different modes
for slower or faster experiences.

Click "Download" and click
it again when redirected.

Open the downloaded zip file
and extract all the contents.
Move everything from the folder that opens

into the scripts folder of
the GTA V base directory
on your computer.

Launch GTA V, and you'll
be able to use the mod
as instructed on the GTA5-mod website.
